data.text:
@StKildaSteele @JonathanHudgins @Reuters 'Didn’t know a single person' =/= 'everyone'
... now trying to generalize from your own personal experience and entourage, i hope that you realize how meaningless it is...
@Reuters After it ebbed naturally, as it always does, is what you mean.

@StKildaSteele @JonathanHudgins @Reuters Again you are putting words into my mouth: i asked you to substantiate your OP claims (and i could ask you about every subsequent ones) and you didn't at all...

@StKildaSteele @JonathanHudgins @Reuters 'The fact is, people from HK don’t share your views' [sic]

Once again you don't know 'my views' and can't substantiate your claims with anything.
@StKildaSteele @JonathanHudgins @Reuters I am pro-facts whatever the topic at hand, and here again.

@sensiN23 @JonathanHudgins @Reuters It is literally true… I just moved back from Hong Kong. Didn’t know a single person who wanted to be integrated back into China. Everyone was either in favour of the one party two systems, or wanted independence https://t.co/RX9Hx1ujPV

@StKildaSteele @JonathanHudgins @Reuters I am trusting substantiated & corroborated facts vs bogus & unsubstantiated figures peddled by people with a conflict of interest, like the organizers.

Let's sum up: your OP claim that 'nearly everybody' is anti-China is all coming from a bogus figure for a demo back in 2019.

@sensiN23 @JonathanHudgins @Reuters Lmao going through your tweets. You are clearly pro-CCP/China. Which is fine, it’s your opinion. But It really dosen’t matter tho what your views on China and HK are tho. The fact is, people from HK don’t share your views. Nearly every HongKonger is pro-democracy and anti-ccp.
